sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"机会"之意。
means: chance ： 侧重指偶然或意外的机会，有时也指正常或好的机会。
opportunity ： 侧重指有利或适合于采取行动，以达到某一目的或实现某种愿望的最佳时机或机会。
occasion ： 指特殊时机或良机，也指时节。

sentence.Network_en: On one occasion, his father threw a radio at his mother.
sentence.Network_cn: 他父亲曾有一次拎起收音机砸向他的母亲。

sentence.Network_en: The good weather helped to make the occasion a resounding success.
sentence.Network_cn: 天公作美，使得这次活动获得了巨大成功。

sentence.Network_en: It is always an important occasion for setting out government policy.
sentence.Network_cn: 这历来都是阐明政府政策的重要时机。

lj.lj_ly: on occasion, the state was asked to intervene.
lj.lj_ls: 有时政府会被要求进行干预。

jx.jx_en_mean: perform better than usual in response to a special situation or event
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在特殊场合超常发挥，在特殊场合应付裕如

jx.jx_en_mean: (archaic)make use of an opportunity to do something
From time to time; now and then.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin occasio(n-) 'juncture, reason', from occidere 'go down, set', from ob- 'towards' + cadere 'to fall'

entry.def: An occasion is a time when something happens, or a case of it happening.

example.ex: I often think fondly of an occasion some years ago at Covent Garden...
example.tran: 我时常愉快地回想起几年前在科文特花园的一个时刻。

example.ex: Mr Davis has been asked on a number of occasions.
example.tran: 戴维斯先生曾多次被问及。

entry.def: An occasion is an important event, ceremony, or celebration.

example.ex: Taking her with me on official occasions has been a challenge...
example.tran: 带着她出席正式场合对我来说一直是个挑战。

example.ex: It will be a unique family occasion.
example.tran: 这将是一次特别的家庭聚会。

entry.def: An occasion for doing something is an opportunity for doing it.

example.ex: It is an occasion for all the family to celebrate...
example.tran: 这是个值得举家庆祝的时刻。

example.ex: It is always an important occasion for setting out government policy.
example.tran: 这历来都是阐明政府政策的重要时机。

entry.def: To occasion something means to cause it.

example.ex: He argued that the release of hostages should not occasion a change in policy.
example.tran: 他认为释放人质不应造成政策的改变。

entry.def: If you have occasion to do something, it is necessary for you to do it.

example.ex: We have had occasion to deal with members of the group on a variety of charges.
example.tran: 我们有必要以多项罪名起诉该组织的成员。

entry.def: If something happens on occasion, it happens sometimes, but not very often.

example.ex: He treated them seriously and, on occasion, entertained them hilariously...
example.tran: 他对待他们严肃认真，偶尔又逗得他们捧腹不已。

example.ex: He translated not only from the French but also, on occasion, from the Polish.
example.tran: 他不仅做法文翻译，有时也做些波兰语翻译。

entry.tran: 成功应付困难局面；关键时刻发挥作用
entry.def: If you say that someone rose to the occasion, you mean that they did what was necessary to successfully overcome a difficult situation.

example.ex: Inverness, however, rose to the occasion in the second half, producing some of the best football they have played for some time.
example.tran: 然而，因弗内斯队在下半场经受住了考验，踢出了很长一段时间以来的最佳水平。

means.word_mean: 1. an event that occurs at a critical time;

sentences.sentence: "at such junctures he always had an impulse to leave"
"it was needed only on special occasions"
"an occasion arranged to honor the president"
"a seemingly endless round of social functions"

means.word_mean: 4. the time of a particular event;

sentences.sentence: "there was never an occasion for her to demonstrate her skill"

auth_sentence.content: Fruit and vegetable matter is also eaten on occasion.
auth_sentence.res_content: Fruit and vegetable matter is also eaten on occasion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Fruit and vegetable matter is also eaten on occasion.

auth_sentence.content: Sentiments that on occasion come across as slightly preachy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sentiments that on occasion come across as slightly preachy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sentiments that on occasion come across as slightly preachy.

auth_sentence.content: He is a big player for the big occasion.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is a big player for the big occasion.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =fall,表示"落下,降临"; 2. 引申为偶然发生

stems_affixes.word_buile: cas落下,降临+ual……的→落下的→不是安排好的→偶然的
cas落下+cad落下+e→落下再落下→瀑布

stems_affixes.value_cn: 事, 病例, 案例, 情形, 场合
stems_affixes.word_buile: cas落下,降临+e→[某事]降临,发生→事, 病例, 案例, 情形, 场合
casual偶然的+ty表名词→[突然]落下的事→事故
oc使+cas落下+ion表名词→使……落下→事情发生

Sentence.sentence: In a 2011 study, for instance, people who drank the same 380-calorie(卡路里) milkshake on two separate occasions produced different levels of hunger-related hormones (荷尔蒙), depending on whether the shake's label said it contained 620 or 140 calories.
Mr David Rossi stated that he had spoken with McLaughlin on several occasions about his driving record.
The man can dress casually for the occasion.
But it is natural to desire to do so for special occasions.
Yes, this does happen on occasion.
On the occasions when hunting has been tried, local animal rights people have worked to secure court orders against the hunts.

sentences.en: I want to take this occasion to thank you.
sentences.cn: 我想借此机会向你表示感谢。

sentences.en: I only wear a tie on special occasions.
sentences.cn: 我只有在特殊的场合才系领带。

sentences.en: There was no occasion to do so.
The thing has occasioned us a lot of trouble.
sentences.cn: 这件事给我们带来很大麻烦。

jushi.english: There was no occasion to do so.
I want to take this occasion to thank you.
jushi.chinese: 我想借此机会向你表示感谢。

jushi.english: I only wear a tie on special occasions.
jushi.chinese: 我只有在特殊的场合才系领带。
